br.com.anteros.cups4j.util

Class ByteUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • br.com.anteros.cups4j.util.ByteUtilities

  • public class ByteUtilities
extends Object
    Place for all raw static byte conversion functions. Especially useful for converting typed Hex (String base 16) to byte[], byte[] to Hex (String base 16), byte[] to int[] conversions, etc.
    Author:
    Tres Finocchiaro

    • Constructor Summary

      ByteUtilities()

      Base 2 array to Base 10 array converter: Takes a binary array (using a boolean array for storage) and converts every 8 rows to a full byte, keeping the value in decimal (int).

    • Method Detail

      • hexStringToByteArray

        public static byte[] hexStringToByteArray(String s)
                                   throws NumberFormatException
        Converts typed Hex (String base 16) to byte[]. This is especially useful for special characters that are appended via JavaScript, specifically the "\0" or NUL character, which will early terminate a JavaScript String.
        Parameters:
        s - Base 16 String to covert to byte array
        Returns:
        byte array
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException

      • bytesToHex

        public static String bytesToHex(byte[] bytes)

      • bytesToHex

        public static String bytesToHex(byte[] bytes,
                                boolean upperCase)

      • indicesOfSublist

        public static int[] indicesOfSublist(byte[] array,
                                     byte[] sublist)
        Iterates through byte array finding matches of a sublist of bytes. Returns an array of positions. TODO: Make this natively Iterable.
        Parameters:
        array - byte array to search
        sublist - sublist to search for
        Returns:
        indicies to found sublists

      • splitByteArray

        public static LinkedList<ByteArrayBuilder> splitByteArray(byte[] src,
                                                          byte[] pattern,
                                                          int count)
                                                   throws NullPointerException,
                                                          IndexOutOfBoundsException,
                                                          ArrayStoreException
        When supplied a src byte[] array, pattern byte[] array and count, this returns a LinkedList of byte[] split at the nth instance of the supplied pattern. (nth being the supplied count parameter) This is useful for large print batches that need to be split up (for example) after the P1 or ^XO command has been issued. TODO: A rewrite of this would be a proper Iteratable interface paired with an Iterator that does this automatically and would eliminate the need for a indicesOfSublist() function.
        Parameters:
        src - array to split
        pattern - pattern to determine where split should occur
        count - number of arrays to split data into
        Returns:
        array of byte arrays
        Throws:
        NullPointerException
        IndexOutOfBoundsException
        ArrayStoreException

      • intArrayToByteArray

        public static byte[] intArrayToByteArray(int[] ints)

      • binaryArrayToIntArray

        public static int[] binaryArrayToIntArray(boolean[] black)
        Base 2 array to Base 10 array converter: Takes a binary array (using a boolean array for storage) and converts every 8 rows to a full byte, keeping the value in decimal (int). Returns an array of integers (int[]). These integers will likely be converted to a byte array (byte[]) later.
        Parameters:
        black - boolean values to convert
        Returns:
        number array in base 10

      • getHexString

        public static String getHexString(int[] raw)
        Converts an integer array (int[]) to a String representation of a hexadecimal array.
        Parameters:
        raw - numbers to be converted to hex
        Returns:
        hex string representation

      • isBlank

        public static boolean isBlank(Object o)

        public static boolean isBase64Image(String path)

      • readBinaryFile

        public static byte[] readBinaryFile(String file)
                             throws IOException
        Reads a binary file (i.e. PDF) from URL to a ByteBuffer. This is later appended to the applet, but needs a renderer capable of printing it to PostScript
        Parameters:
        file - URL string to location of file
        Returns:
        byte array containing file content
        Throws:
        IOException
